Le Brull   is a dental clinic attached to the CHU of Liège.

If it is an emergency   the patient is required to wait for an indefinite period of time and care will be provided according to the degree of urgency of his or her case.

A so-called “mini-enterprise” is a company created by young people in their final year of secondary school   who in addition to this activity   study economics   for example
The process of creating a mini-business begins with the application to LJE   the organization that oversees the activity
LJE takes the application into consideration and will then visit the students
The students submit the project   for example the creation of a drink   and briefly describe their ambitions
The students have to start looking for a minimum capital of 700 euros
Following this   an opening general meeting is held in order to legally create the entity
This is followed by a year of sales   fairs   and learning
If the project fails and the team dissolves   an extraordinary meeting must be called to warn the shareholders
If the activity goes smoothly   a general meeting is scheduled in April   all shareholders must be called at least 15 days before
If they do not wish to attend the event   they must either authorize another person to attend in their place with a written proxy   or notify the company in writing of their absence
The document must be in A4 format   sent in pdf format and legible
At the end of the year   the students dissolve the company   either by donating the capital to an association or by returning it to the shareholders
This depends on the dynamics of each group
If the share has increased in value   the shareholder will have realized a capital gain   if the share is lower than its initial value   he will have made a capital loss
For students who do not wish to dissolve the company   it is possible to continue the project and be supported by an incubator
The Erasmus is the journey of a lifetime
First of all   the student goes to the International Relations Department in order to consult various testimonies of former students
If none of them seduced him   they can either abandon their project or consider a double degree
In the latter case   they consult Mrs. Gillet and the process stops
If the student is interested and after consulting the testimonies   they will select their favorite destinations
They will then register in the student ranking
If their average is sufficient   they will be able to go to one of their favorite destinations
If not   they will be assigned another destination without affecting the rest of the process
Some students are very disappointed   frustrated and regret not having worked harder to get a better place in the ranking
Anyway   the student then contacts the university that will host them
They receive their learning agreement from the University of Liège   transfer it to their host university and start looking for accommodation
Students are also advised to learn some of the language of the host country   but few apply this advice

Once the departure date arrives   the student goes to their host university and gives a paper to be signed by the local office   which they send directly to the University of Liège to prove that they are in fact there
The student spends one semester in their new school
At the end of this time   the student takes the examinations and obtains a certificate of achievement   which they hand over to the University of Liège on their return
In case of failure   the student will retake the exams abroad   until obtaining the certificate   in order to close the Erasmus

In march 2021   if a person wants to enter Belgium from abroad   he/she needs to follow some procedures
This situation is due to the corona crisis that the world is living
The person needs first to check which measures apply when leaving the country he/she is currently in
Those measures are different depending on the country

When the person knows what to do to leave   he/she needs to fill up an online document regarding the entrance in Belgium by filling many personal information and precising weather he/she stays longer than 48h in Belgium or not and if he/she is resident of Belgium
If the person is a Belgian resident   he/she will not be asked to provide a negative PCR test before entering the country
If the person is not Belgian resident   he/she will be required to provide a negative PCR test
If the person stays less than 48   the person is not required to quarantine and a PCR test
If the person plans to stay longer than 48h   he/she will have to self-isolate for 10 days   and to do a PCR test at the first and 7th day of quarantine
When the person enters Belgium   he/she receives an SMS with a code and a link
The sms is written in Dutch   French and German
The person can then click on the link and book an appointment for the first PCR test using the code he/she was provided
Another SMS with another code will follow for the second PCR test
If the second test is positive   the person needs to keep self-isolating and do another test 7 days after
The process ends when the person is negative to COVID-19

The restaurant for which I worked   holds a managing system for the tables’ bookings.
When a client phones to book a table   and communicates the datum when he wants to come   the waiter needs to check the availability of tables.
If a table is available on that day   the process will keep going   if no table is available   either the client will postpone to another date   or he will cancel his request and the process is over.
If it’s a table for more than 4 people   they will be sitting in the “Fish room”   if they’re less or equal to 4 people   they will be placed in the “Harbour room”.
If there is a free table in the room desired   the table will be booked and the waiter will communicate the table number to the client (in order to make it easier for when the customer arrives
The customer will communicate the accurate time when he will be there.
The waiter will register the hour in his program.
When the client arrives   the waiter has to open the table on his program to confirm that the client arrived.

If the waiter hasn’t opened the table on his program in the 20 minutes while the client was supposed to   the reservation will automatically be canceled and the table will be free again for an eventual other client.
The waiter will go regularly to the client’s table to check that everything is ok.
All the food and drinks ordered by the client will be registered by the waiter on the program with the customer’s table assigned.
If the bill is more than 60€   a drink will be offered   otherwise nothing will be offered.
The “table” (on the computer program  will be closed when the client will have paid either by cash or by card.
The process is finished
My sister is working as a recruiter in a big company in which there is a special process to hire people.
First   when they are looking for a new candidate to work for them   she will place a job description on the website of the company.
If someone is interested in applying for the job   he will be asked to send an email to her e-mail address.
She will receive dozens of applications.
She will only keep people who can either speak English and/or Dutch   those who can’t speak any of those languages will be out.
She will notify them by e-mail that their application has been rejected.
She will contact by phone the most interesting profiles to make an interview in face-to-face with them.
On the phone   they will agree on a datum to meet.
After having seen all the interesting candidates   she will write a report   a debriefing on the best 3 candidates and show it to her director.
If the report is clear enough and that the manager can make a decision thanks to it   he will choose the candidate without having seeing him.
Otherwise   he will arrange a meeting with the best candidates.
If one candidate has been selected   he will receive an email to be informed that he is selected and the others who haven’t been selected   will also be informed by email.

The following description s about how the Belgian Justice system makes the decision to investigate or not on a death
The process starts when a cadaver is found somewhere
A forensic doctor determines if the death is suspect or not
If the death is not suspect   a certificate of death is emitted   and funerals can be organised normally
If the death is suspect   a complementary analysis is done to determine if someone is involved in the death or not
If no one is involved in the death   then the death is due to natural causes or suicide
If the death is due to natural causes   a certificate of death is emitted   and funerals can be organised normally
If the death is due to a suicide   a small investigation takes place to confirm the suicide
If the suicide is confirmed   then a certificate of death is emitted   and funerals can be organised normally
If funerals can be organised normally   then the process ends
If the suicide is not confirmed   then someone is involved in the death
If someone is involved in the death   then a full police investigation is started
If the author is known   a magistrate decides if the Local Police or the Federal Judicial Police conducts the investigation
Then   the investigators determine the causes and circumstances of death
If the author is unknown   the Federal Judicial Police conducts the investigation
If the author can be identified   then the investigators determine the causes and circumstances of death
If the author cannot be identified   then the investigators make complementary research
The research could be international or not
After the complementary research   if the author is identified   then the investigators determine the causes and circumstances of death
If the author is not identified   then the murder becomes a “cold case”
After determining the causes and circumstances of death   the investigation ends
Once the investigation is over   Judicial decisions concerning the author of the murder have to be made

In order to get exhaustive regulations and custom tariffs rates regarding their products   operator refer to the TARIC code and its database   which includes all applicable customs duties and all customs trade policy measures for all goods
When the goods arrive by any kind of freight such as train   sea   air   the customs must check physically the goods before it realease
To do so   operator are informed by email which sample of goods customs must verify based on the ENS and the hour gap when customs will come
Consequently   operator prepares the batch otherwise a penalty will be given therefore the warehouse staff is ordered to pull every goods needed and attach all the suitable documents

The control can lead to 2 results
Customs can either seal an apporval or reject the declaration and keep the good

The administrator analyses the documents
If nothing is missing   he closes the case and sends the decision to the student
If some documents are missing   the administrator sends and email to ask for the missing documents
The student has 30 days to respond
If he does not respond within 30 days   he is notified that his case is closed   and he will not receive a grant   the process is finished
When the student sends the documents within 30 days   the administrator checks the documents
The administrator communicates the answer through postal mail to the student
If it is a negating answer   the student is notified that he will not receive a grant and the process is finished
If it is a positive answer   the student is notified that he will receive a grant and how much he will receive
When the student receives his grant   the process is finished
The grant can vary from 400 to 5000 euros
A student has bad grades in statistics and wants to take online courses

An automatic chatbox opens and asks the student for his choice of course
The student asks for a specific course on the platform
The student chooses his tutor and validates his choice
For example   the tutor named Lara and specialized in marketing
The platform shares the schedule of the monitor in a new page
The student selects the slot/timetable
He can change the visualization of the schedule (calendar): by day or by week

“La Coccinella” is a pizzeria located in Visé   in the province of Liège   and is open every day from Tuesday to Sunday
The business process starts when a customer calls the pizzeria to take an order
The phone rings at the pizzeria and an employee pick up the phone
The employee asks the order to the customer
The customer tells his order and the employee write down the order at the same time
For example: “I would like a 4 Cheese pizza   2 Margarita pizza’s and 1 Bolognese pizza please
Then the employee tells the customer at what time he can pick up his order at the pizzeria and asks him its name
For example: “You can pick up your order at 7.15 pm
The customer tells its name
The employee who took the order forwards it to the pizza chef
The pizza chef prepares the order
The customer goes to the pizzeria
The customer pays by card or by cash
An employee supplies the customer with its order
The customer takes his order and go back home to eat pizza
End of the process
“Visé voyages” is an independent travel agency in Visé   in the province of Liège
The customer enters the agency
The employee takes charge of the customer and the customer sit at the desk
The employee asks him its preferences
For example: “I would like to go Madagascar with my wife between July 20 and August 15 for 2 weeks
For example: I would like a 5-star hotel   with a private beach and at least one swimming pool
I have an unlimited budget
The employee looks for different hotels on his computer and shows them to the customer
Either the customer likes a hotel or not
If the customer does not like any hotel   the employee can give him catalogs to look by himself or not   and he leaves the travel agency
The business model is over
If the client likes a hotel   he asks the employee to book it
The employee asks the client some personal information
For example   he asks its name   ID-card   address   birthdate   … (Example sentence)
The client gives his personal information and the employee filled out the booking form
The client signs the booking form
The client pays a deposit by card or by cash
The employee gives documents to the client with the booking confirmation

The employee gives further information about the final payment and ask the client how he will receive the travel documents: either he comes to pick up its documents in the travel agency   or he receives them by mail
The client tells his preference
The client leaves the agency

Colruyt is a Belgian supermarket chain

Concerning the cash desk   the process starts when a client arrives with his trolley at the cash desk   they have to let their (full) trolley next to an empty trolley that is already standing at the cash desk
The cashier enters then his personnel number on the screen next to him and say hello to the client
The cashier also asks the client if he has his Extra-card or discount vouchers: if the client has them   the cashier needs to scan them and has to put the vouchers in a special drawer
However   it is not necessary that the cashier scans the card and the vouchers before scanning the articles   he can scan them while scanning the articles
The cashier scans the products that are in the client’s trolley
Once the products are scanned   the cashier can hear a sound to confirm it is well scanned and the cashier has to transfer them in the trolley that was empty when the client arrived at the cash desk
The cashier usually scans the barcode or the QR code standing on the product for example

However   concerning fruits and vegetables that are in bulk   the cashier needs to put them in the scale and type the number associated with the fruit on the screen (for example   ‘2929’ is the number of trusses of tomatoes while ‘55’ is the number of tomatoes without trusses)
There is a little notebook under the screen with a list of the fruits and vegetables and their associated numbers to help the cashier
When the scale has weighted the fruits and vegetables well   the cashier will hear a sound to confirm that it is weighted

When the cashier is not able to scan the barcode or to find the fruit’s number   he has to make a call to a colleague to help him: the colleague he will call depends on the department from where the product is (for example: the ‘fridge room’ or the shop) and from where his colleagues are working at that moment
For example   if the product the cashier doesn’t find the barcode is from the fridge room   he will call a colleague that is working at that moment in the fridge room to ask for the product number
There is a schedule which is displayed at the checkout where you can see who is in which department and at what time
The cashier transfers all the products to the trolley that was empty at the beginning
the cashier clicks on the screen on the button ‘Finished’
If something is remaining in the scale   a popup will appear on the screen   preventing the cashier from accessing the payment screen
If nothing is remaining in the scale   the window of the cashier screen will close
Then   the cashier will invite the client to follow him to another screen in order to pay
The cashier will enter his personnel number again and will tell the client the amount of money he has to pay
Then   he will select on the screen whether the client pays with his card   restaurant ticket or cash
The cashier will encode the amount that the customer pays (depending on the means of payment)
When all the amount is paid   the cash drawer will open and the receipt will be printed automatically
The cashier will close the cash drawer   give the receipt to the customer and say goodbye
Finally   the customer leaves the shop with his shopping trolley   the process is finished
Amazon is an e-commerce website where you can find everything you want to
When a client wants something   he  type the name of the item in the search bar
Then   the client will be proposed a multitude of products related to what he has written in the search bar
Afterwards   the customer clicks on an article he likes and click on   add to basket   if he wants to buy it
He will be proposed complementary items to the item he has chosen
(for example: if he buys a coffee machine   he will be offered to buy the capsules that go with it)
Then   he will have the opportunity to either continue his purchases or to click on “place the order”
If the client decides to place the order   he will be asked his personal information (name and address for the shipment)
Also   he will be asked how he wants the parcel to be shipped (fast or normal service  …)
Finally   the customer will have to pay
When the payment is confirmed   the client will receive an email of confirmation with the date at which the parcel is supposed to arrive

Then   Amazon gives the parcel to a distributor which will deliver the parcel to the client while the client will have the opportunity to track his parcel in order to know where the parcel actually is for that moment
Finally   the client receives his parcel and the process is finished

Once this is done   the worker drops the package off at the collection point selected by the consumer

The customer then goes to the collection point and picks up their shopping list
The recipes selected by the customer are ready to be made with love

Marbaise is a shoe shop but it also sells some clothes
The process starts when the customer enters into the shop
A seller notifies that a customer has entered
The seller asks the customer if he needs help
The customer asks to the seller for the pair of shoes he is looking for (such as a pair of Nike shoes in size 42)
The customer tries it on if it is available in the shop   otherwise the employee goes to the stockroom to check if there are any left (Marbaise has a big stockroom to store a lot of items)
If there is a pair of shoes left in the shop's stock   the customer tries them on   otherwise the employee tells the customer that there are none left and the customer leaves   the process is over
If the pair of shoes does not fit   the customer leaves and the process is over and if it fits   the employee scans the shoe box to register it in the cash register
The customer pays at the checkout and leaves with the shoes   the process is fulfilled
TUI is a well-known travel agency in the Verviers region and is located in the city centre
The process starts when the customer enters into the travel agency
The customer expresses the travel characteristics he is looking for to the employee

The employee encodes them in the computer in order to obtain trips that correspond to the customer's request (TUI has a very competent computer system that makes it possible to compare all the different travel offers)
The employee prints out the different travel options and offers them to the customer
Either the customer decides directly and makes a choice on the spot or he leaves the agency and comes back when he is decided (this can be a few days later or even 1 or 2 weeks later)
When the client has decided   the travel agency books the trip for the client
The client pays a deposit or the whole trip to confirm the booking
The agency employee prints out the booking confirmation and gives it to the client
The customer leaves when he has received the confirmation and the process is finished
''Tartiflette'' is a French recipe   ideal for sharing with family and friends after a dav of skiing

You must first preheat the oven to 200 degrees
Then peel the potatoes   dice them and pre-eook in a pan of salted boiling water for 5-10 minutes
In the meantime   fry an onion In a pan with a Iittle fat

The customer needs to be insured
Customer send insurance request to the insurance company
Insurance seller receive the insurance request from the customer
Insurance seller read the customer’s request
Insurance seller check if the request is a standard one
If it is   he prepares standard terms/provisions
If it is not   he prepares special terms/provisions
At the same time   the risk analyst has to analyze the customer’s risks
For example   based on previous car accidents   age   number of years of experience   etc
Then   the insurance seller prepares the contract (terms   premium to pay   etc
The insurance seller sends the contract to the customer
The customer receives the contract
The customer reads the contract and his terms
If the customer accepts the contract   he sends an acceptance letter
The process is completed

Student needs an internship
Student sends his application to the company
Human resources department of the company receives the application
Human resources department check student’s application
For example   his skills   practical experience   interests
If HR department decides to refuse   it sends a rejection notification to the student   the application has failed
If HR department decides to accept   it sends an acceptance letter to the student
Student sends the internship convention to the HR department
HR department sign the internship convention
HR department sends the signed internship convention to the student
Student receives the signed internship convention by the company
Student send the internship convention to his University
The university receives the internship convention signed by the company
The university signs the internship convention
The university sends the internship convention signed by both parties to the student
The application is completed
The University sometimes need student tutors for some courses
When a new student tutor is needed   the assistant in charge of the selection process firstly spots the students who passed the exam with a very good grade
The assistant decides which student they want to contact
The assistant sends an email to the potential candidate to offer them the job
The student might ask for some time to think about the job offer
In that case   they can have a one-week delay to make their final decision
If the student does not answer or rejects the offer   their application is cancelled and the process starts again with the assistant having to spot another candidate
If the student accepts the offer   the assistant sends them the application form
The student fills in the application form and sends it back to the assistant with a copy of their ID and a “Student@Work” certification
The “Student@Work” certification is a document from the Belgian Government which ensures that the student has not exceeded the amount of hours they can work as a student
The professor in charge of the course signs the application form of the student tutor candidate
Once it has been signed by the professor   the necessary documentation is sent by the assistant to the Human Resource Department of the University
The Human Resource Department makes the official contract   prints out two copies and sends them both by post to the student
When they have received the official contract   the student signs both copies
The student then keeps one copy and sends the other to the assistant
The selection process is thus over as the student has their official student tutor contract
